alert.note: Alert for Coal; Johnston (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 02 at 9:31PM CDT until May 03 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL JOHNSTON...SOUTHERN COAL AND SOUTH CENTRAL PONTOTOC COUNTIES... At 931 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 6 miles northeast of Pontotoc, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Coalgate, Lehigh, Centrahoma, Olney, Clarita and Phillips. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter, safe room, or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
